title.value: Machine Learning Informed Diagnosis for Congenital Heart Disease in Large Claims Data Source
title.justification: This title accurately reflects the focus of the paper on using machine learning techniques to diagnose congenital heart disease using large claims databases.
title.quote: Machine Learning Informed Diagnosis for Congenital Heart Disease in Large Claims Data Source

extractions.description: This paper explores the use of various machine learning methods to accurately identify patients with congenital heart disease (CHD) from large claims databases, using datasets from Quebec. It compares the performance of different machine learning models like Gradient Boosting Decision Tree and Support Vector Machine against a regularized logistic regression baseline.

type.justification: The paper involves practical experiments with different machine learning models applied to datasets for diagnosing congenital heart disease, which is indicative of empirical research.
type.quote: To establish an accurate ML-empowered automated CHD classification system, we evaluated ML methods including Gradient Boosting Decision Tree, Support Vector Machine, Decision tree, and compared them to regularized logistic regression.

name.justification: The research focuses on using machine learning to process and analyze healthcare claims data for disease diagnosis.
name.quote: This study aims to establish a machine learning (ML) approach to identify patients with congenital heart disease (CHD) in large claims databases.

name.justification: The study applies machine learning techniques to diagnose CHD.
name.quote: This study aims to establish a machine learning (ML) approach to identify patients with congenital heart disease (CHD) in large claims databases.

name.justification: The study aims to diagnose congenital heart disease, which is a subject within cardiology.
name.quote: BACKGROUND With an increasing interest in using large claims databases in medical practice and research, it is a meaningful and essential step to efficiently identify patients with the disease of interest.

name.justification: This model showed the best performance among the evaluated methods.
name.quote: Among the ML methods we evaluated, Gradient Boosting Decision Tree led the performance in identifying true CHD patients with 99.3% Area Under the Precision Recall Curve.

is_contributed.justification: The model is not a new contribution but an application of existing models.
is_contributed.quote: we evaluated ML methods including Gradient Boosting Decision Tree
